pullRequest.title: Improvements to lighting engine mappings
pullRequest.bodyText: This PR focuses on improving the consistency of mappings within the lighting engine, as well as adding a few more new names. The main confusion arises from the packed long parameters which represent different things, but are often not described within the method or argument name.

nodes.bodyText: I think it's better to leave these as pos rather than blockPos.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -42,11 +42,13 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_3558 net/minecraft/world/chunk/light/ChunkLightProvide
 		ARG 5 direction
 		ARG 6 opacity2
 	METHOD method_20479 getStateForLighting (JLorg/apache/commons/lang3/mutable/MutableInt;)Lnet/minecraft/class_2680;
-		ARG 1 pos
-	METHOD method_20599 setRetainData (Lnet/minecraft/class_1923;Z)V
+		ARG 1 blockPos

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change COMMENT The smallest unit within LightStorage is the section. Sections represent a cube of 16x16x16 blocks and their lighting data. COMMENT

The smallest unit within LightStorage is the section. Sections represent a cube of 16x16x16 blocks and their lighting data.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,15 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_3560 net/minecraft/world/chunk/light/LightStorage
+	COMMENT LightStorage handles the access, storage and propagation of a specific kind of light within the world.
+	COMMENT For example, separate instances will be used to store block light as opposed to sky light.
+	COMMENT
+	COMMENT The smallest unit within LightStorage is the section. Sections represent a cube of 16x16x16 blocks and their lighting data.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change COMMENT To avoid allocations, LightStorage packs all the coordinate arguments into single long values. Extra care should be taken COMMENT

To avoid allocations, LightStorage packs all the coordinate arguments into single long values. Extra care should be taken Without these paragraph split, the rendered javadoc will just have continuous sentences.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,15 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_3560 net/minecraft/world/chunk/light/LightStorage
+	COMMENT LightStorage handles the access, storage and propagation of a specific kind of light within the world.
+	COMMENT For example, separate instances will be used to store block light as opposed to sky light.
+	COMMENT
+	COMMENT The smallest unit within LightStorage is the section. Sections represent a cube of 16x16x16 blocks and their lighting data.
+	COMMENT In turn, 16 sections stacked on top of each other form a column, which are analogous to the standard 16x256x16 world chunks.
+	COMMENT
+	COMMENT To avoid allocations, LightStorage packs all the coordinate arguments into single long values. Extra care should be taken
